events.target_title: Gnome-shell crashes when we use "workspace-grid" extension ( affects gnome-shell=3.30.2 )
Gnome-shell crashes when we use "workspace-grid" extension ( affects gnome-shell=3.30.2 )

note.body:
I did some debugging and I can confirm that, it is not a mutter bug.

Actual problem lies on this function call 
```
  /* Get current workspace */
  if (meta_prop_get_cardinal (x11_display,
                              x11_display->xroot,
                              x11_display->atom__NET_CURRENT_DESKTOP,
                              &current_workspace_index))
```
@ https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/blob/master/src/x11/meta-x11-display.c#L1308

which returns wrong value.

Due to that wrong value, the condition  @ https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/blob/master/src/core/workspace.c#L537
```
  if (workspace->manager->active_workspace == workspace)
    return;
```
evaluates false and the `return` statement is not evaluated.

This is the root cause of this bug.

failure to compute `current_workspace_index` can be due to wrong calculation done by workspace-grid extension or due to some API change in mutter.

regression in building flatpak
regression in building flatpak

note.body:
Oh god, I found it...
This is embarrassing, but on the other hand might be a problem to a tone of people. If your flatpak manifest contains a tailing ´,´ in any element, it will not be recognized as a flatpak manifest any more. There actually is a message in the debug log telling you this.

```
20:42:25.3849               gbp-flatpak-config-provider[   12]:  MESSAGE: org.deisi.jabref.json is not a flatpak manifest, skipping: <data>:29:59: Parse error: unexpected character `,', expected character `]'
``` 

but because this is not shown in any kind of whay during usage of the IDE this is really really hard to spot. Comming from python this is extra hard, as tailling `,` are considered best practice in python, while they are fatal for `json` files. This really needs some kind of warning, as it will waste thousand of hours.

events.target_title: Open file via Windows 10 context menu "Edit with GIMP" opens extra dialog

note.body:
I just noticed this issue and was able to confirm it on multiple machines. Windows 10 on all of them, but different versions. LTSB 2016, 1703, 1803.
GIMP Installer for windows (2.10.6 and apparently all .10 before it) does not update "Edit with GIMP" links in HKLM registry. it keeps "gimp-2.8.exe" as it's target.
Fresh install does write "gimp-2.10.exe" as it should be.

events.target_title: Open file via Windows 10 context menu "Edit with GIMP" opens extra dialog

note.body: Also noticed GIMP 2.10.8 exists, and it's installer (gimp-2.10.8-setup-2) appears to properly write registry links, so this issue is probably fixed.

Well, yes, I use the MATE desktop, which can be extended with gnome-disk-utility to access storage devices. And gnome-disk-utility is the only package pulling in libsecret. I prefer not to have gnome-keyring, nor its successor libsecret, on my system. Chromium, for example, started popping up lots of passphrase dialogs for no good reason lately. Without that packages, all fine. Well, that's about it.

As for the option name, feel free to change. I will update the patch.

I also came upon the same issue.

System: 
Windows 10 Prox64; Meld Version 3.18.3 (downloaded yesterday)

File: 
˜800 lines of php; first difference in 689

Reproduction:
Cursor is in the first line
Alt+down pressed

Cursor and view jumping to line 689

Actual behaviour:
Cursor jumping to line 689, view jumping to line 55

Diamond Gaussian Blur
Diamond Gaussian Blur

note.body:
It is a little subtle, though it's more obvious if you open the image in a new tab and zoom all the way in. But I went ahead and outlined the diamond shape.

Reproduction steps:
1. Open the bad blur (second image) file in Gimp 2.10
2. Set the foreground color to red.
3. Select the fill tool. Set the threshold value to 1.
4. Click in each corner of the image, skipping corners that are already filled in (my first click filled in 3 corners because I didn't put the blur exactly centered).

The result is this weird rounded diamond shape rather than a smooth circle. 

![redblur](/uploads/ba54220179455a64b6d8536a88c5c9d4/redblur.png)

If you perform the same four steps except with the good blur (first image) then you get a nice circular outline.
![redgoodblur](/uploads/eafdd17975dd246ded57080b3d980ecf/redgoodblur.png)

Note that the blur is off-center in both images. This has nothing to do with the bug, it's just that I didn't center them exactly since I wasn't trying to make it pretty.

note.body:
I looked at the failed CI track (on Fedora, it seems). Shortly, I doubt this occurred because of the patch. It seems to be more related to a glitch in the CI platform. Or, prove me wrong, I might possibly have missed something (I am new to this platform!)!

Concerning LTP recent releases, in fact I am not sure it is really relevant to try to be as exhaustive as you recommend it. The simple truth is that most of the people are using lcov (Linux Coverage Project) which is currently stuck with LTP 1.13. 

In fact, I needed to add the LTP 1.13 because I am running an unstable Debian distribution which has `lcov` 1.13 installed and compiling glib with tests and coverage just required to deal with LTP 1.13.

So, in my humble opinion, adding support for LTP 1.13 is good enough for now.

events.target_title: New unlock/login design

note.body:
I would be in favor of preserving a separate lock screen background option. While the privacy issue is more important, there's also users who make use of the option to set a makeshift screensaver by setting it to an XML slideshow. Because of this, I would also suggest that at least the lock screen blur be optional; or work like KDE's where the blur comes in upon user activity (which I guess would just be not blurring the shield). If the user has set a separate lock screen, they never really would see it if it's always blurred.

EDIT: I would guess the login background might also need to be configurable separately if there's concern about showing the users' wallpaper blurred.

events.target_title: task entries with in a List gets duplicated everytime I click the List

note.body:
I'm having exactly the same problem. Every time I go back to the lists screen and then open one of them, each task of this list are duplicated. But if I open another list, the tasks of the most recent opened one mixes with it, and if I keep making this of going and back between each list and the first-list of lists  (the first screen of the app, the parent-mor) time enough, it mixes and add a new row to each one. Depending of how many times I repeat the process, every different list of tasks starts to looks exactly the same and with more and more lines. I'm using Ubuntu 18.04, with communitheme (if it matters) + wayland. 

I'd loved the app but i still having problems to use it because even if I'd closed and opened the window, again and again, the last duplicated items still there and they still adding rows and creating, more and more, one big and equal list in every list of tasks (the only part their displaying sounds differently is at the background's color). The only way to clean it is rebooting, but it just restarts to the expected, right and default number of lines, in other words, rebooting not fixes the adding rows bug, just put us back to the begginning.

In fact, I think that the issues may be in DevHelp Reference rather than Glade ( sorry ). However, here are steps to reproduce

1.  Glade Actions Menu -> "Developer Reference"
2.  Note DevHelp opens with book:gladeui but nothing is displayed
3.  Goto Contents -> GTK+ 3 Reference -> GTK+ Overview -> Building Applications
4.  Scroll down the reference, and you will see many "MISSING XINCLUDE CONTENT" 

I am using Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, DevHelp 3.28.1

Now that I have thought more about this, clearly this is an issue with DevHelp documentation, and perhaps even the Ubuntu build.

I've closed this issue, thanks 
Rick

Export to C image artifacts
Export to C image artifacts

note.body:
Thanks for pointing me to the file. I would have had a hard time locating that myself.

There is an one line pre-pad in the output image data allocation that I find suspicious. However, there is a call to gegl_buffer_get that I don't fully understand. I have zero familiarity with GEGL. 

Is there a good place to look up that API's docs? My google-fu isn't working.

Anyway from context I'm going to guess that gegl_buffer_get is extracting one line of the input image and putting it in the pad line. I'm guessing that the problem is that the difference in bytes-per-a-pixel between source and destination is unaccounted for in that pad line. Since the destination bpp is smaller than the input bpp, I'm guessing gegl_buffer_get overruns the pad line and stomps on the first line of the output image. 

If this is the case it may be that [line 497](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gimp/blob/74a7a5d3e2cbc1f070d548cc455bb68d9317964d/plug-ins/common/file-csource.c#L497) just needs to change from:

pad = width * bpp;

to

pad = width * drawable_bpp;

so that the pad line has enough bytes. 

I've never compiled GIMP before so it might take me a bit before I can test that.

events.target_title: Export to C image artifacts

note.body:
Yea, GEGL didn't build under windows using the listed MYSYS procedure. It looks like it had trouble with windows headers as a bunch of Win32 API functions and defines couldn't be found. I didn't see a procedure to point to the Windows SDK but in any case the compiler didn't complain about missing headers, it was missing definitions like GetExitCodeProcess and PROCESS_QUERY_INFORMATION.

I'll have to setup a Linux box some other day and try that procedure.

Ability to search in Nautilus and sort the results by column

note.body:
Hello, a new attendant here. I am not familiar with the details, but surely sorting n items is O(n log(n)) operation, and you would only be sorting the files which you currently have visible on the file browser based on your current search.

The lack of this feature makes it very hard to work with cameras like GoPros and DSLRs as you cannot find the most recent files of a specific type. For example GoPro stores MP4, THM and LRV files, but I am only interested on the most recent MP4 files. With a DSLR you might be storing RAW + JPEG files, and you want to copy most recent JPEG files on your computer and the RAW is just a plan-b if the brightness or color temperature is wrong.

I am surprised that this even needs to be discussed, sadly I do not have the know-how to contribute on solving this problem.

I'm using Linux Debian Buster. 

· I realized that, in order to make it work, I had to do the following:

1st. Go to Select-> All
2nd. Select the type of pencil/brush on the right side of the screen.

· If that doesn't work, I suggest you update the package libbabl and gegl.

· If that doesn't work, I suggest you remove gimp with your packege manager and install it again usin flatpak. Instrutions: https://www.gimp.org/downloads/

But while I personally prefer 1.1x speed, obviously other people may prefer other speeds, so as @anton-z-s mentioned, perhaps allowing gradual change can benefit everyone, even without any change on the main UI, just a hotkey combination (buried somewhere in the Keyboard Shortcuts) as @anton-z-s has suggested.

events.target_title: Dualscreen/Multihead presentation mode

note.body:
It is a shame this has not been implemented yet. I am using evince for my PDF browsing but pdfpc for presentations. I wish I could use evince for everything.

Beamer dual-screen presentation support is a useful feature. There are multiple other programs supporting it.

As to implementation, my request is to support not only 2 full-screen modes but also 2 windows. The rationale as follows: when you connect your laptop to an external display you use different screens. However, when you share your presentation during a video call, it is easier to share just one window. Additionally, window managers like `i3` allow easily to move windows into separate screens/desktops.

events.target_title: Limo Hire Melbourne
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'
ТРЕБУЮ ПРАВИЛЬНОГО ПЕРЕВОДА МЕНЮ "УНИВЕРСАЛЬНЫЙ ДОСТУП"

note.body:
1. В MacOS есть приложение Universal Access, которое переводится как "Универсальный доступ". И "accessibility" они также переводят. См. https://www.apple.com/ru/accessibility/
2. В GNOME есть перевод термина Universal Access как "Специальные возможности". См. https://help.gnome.org/users/gnome-help/stable/a11y.html.ru
3. "Accessibility" обычно переводится, как "Специальные возможности". См. https://www.google.com/intl/ru/accessibility/, https://support.google.com/accessibility/android/answer/6006564?hl=ru, https://yandex.ru/support/common/accessibility/about.html, https://developer.mozilla.org/ru/docs/Web/Accessibility.
4. IMHO, "Специальные возможности" звучит привычнее. Разработчики/дизайнеры GNOME, видимо, заимствовали название Universal Access у MacOS, поэтому оно получилось таким непривычным (хотя для пользователей MacOS должно быть наоборот, понятнее).
5. Т.к. перевод не подразумевает изменение терминов, "Универсальный доступ" выглядит более правильным переводом. Если хотите сменить термин, его нужно менять на оригинальном языке.

gnome-calendar aggressively caches hotspot-caused TLS errors for days
gnome-calendar aggressively caches hotspot-caused TLS errors for days

note.body:
Timing is everything. I don't travel much and hadn't seen this problem is AGES. However I was at an airport yesterday - didn't get any cert error (that I can recall) when I connected to their WiFi hotspot - but today at work I suddenly had popups warning me that the "Wellington airport" was trying to subvert my owncloud connection. Sorry - this was 6 hours ago  - before I read your request - so no screenshots. I clicked on the "reject" button to force gnome to keep rejecting that owncloud+cert combo and that shut it up.

ie when I connected, gnome did a network check and popped up a hotspot login window, but in the background GOA attempted to sync to my owncloud account (I have Google, Launchpad and owncloud accounts configured), got a cert verification failure - and as far as I'm aware didn't warn me about it. Then today at work - several hours after working happily on our work network, a notification about the TLS error from yesterday popped up

In "~/.config/goa-1.0/accounts.conf" I can see "AcceptSslErrors=false" on my owncloud account, and in "~/.cache/evolution/sources/0099e55ef70b4...source" I can see "SslTrust=reject|owncloud.domain|50489f469869f7d4940fcd4452bcf1a093733cc8". I assume "50489f469869f7d4940fcd4452bcf1a093733cc8" is the fingerprint of the cert I rejected. The webdav URLs mentioned are all the owncloud URLs - no mention of proxies or hotspots.

I have one owncloud/webdav calendar - but it has two calendars it tracks if that makes a difference (personal and birthdays - standard options)

note.body: I've checked and I have not logged out in days. I just close and open the lid. But I feel you're onto something. If it didn't notify me when the TLS error was occurring and cached that "for later", that would explain why I saw it the next day. Is there any way to create a notification with a timeout? Another thing, what if people dismiss the popup without choosing to allow or decline the cert conflict? Would that cause the underlying system to keep harassing the user or is it treated as a decline (which should be the case IMHO)

events.target_title: Page setup and print commands not responsive to custom settings
Page setup and print commands not responsive to custom settings

note.body:
With this lack of usable printing resources within GIMP, my fall back option was to assemble my book covers in GIMP and then export the graphics as TIF or PNG in the correct size and resolution before viewing them with ACDSee and printing them with doPDF to the correct dimensional settings to create the appropriately-sized PDF image to send to my book binder.

It's a clumsy work-around, but no less awkward than when HP stopped making plotter print drivers for anything past Windows XP, and relied upon their instant print utility that took Autocad image files and converted them internally to a plotter-compatible data stream.

It also negated the ability of all the Intel secretaries to plot directly from Power Point (making posters for their managers) and I had to go around six floors of secretaries and give them a whole new multi-step process for printing partition posters instead of just printing them from within Power Point.

Such is progress ...

CAD = Computer Aided Delay...

-steve

Menus and controls placed in very confusing ways
Menus and controls placed in very confusing ways

note.body:
Thanks for your reply Allan.

The new mockup is much better, from what I can see. However, it still shows the 'save' button on the opposite side to the scan button, when they really belong together. (After pressing 'Scan', very often the next thing you want to do is save the document).

There was a lot of logic in the original placement of the buttons that doesn't seem to have been considered. It is very disappointing that just because someone had [a bright idea](https://blogs.gnome.org/tbernard/2018/01/26/csd-initiative/) to get rid of a long standing UI element, that re-designs should be done with so little actual understanding or user testing.

These issues are in addition to the fact that in the new UI all of the keyboard shortcuts are 1) entirely non-discoverable 2) almost entirely non-functional! (see [bug 14](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/simple-scan/issues/14) - the only one that works for me is Ctrl-S for save). Were there really so few bugs in GNOME to work on that you had to make lots of work for yourselves and major UX regressions for users by doing sweeping interface changes? Which users of this app were asking for it to be changed? What has been gained by the changes? I dread to think what is going to happen to other apps as part of this 'CSD initiative', and my only consolation is that I don't use many actual GNOME apps, which should protect me from most of this. Several years ago I moved away from KDE and KDE apps because the developers decided to break everything and release their changes long before they were ready, now I'm doing the same with GNOME it seems. Hopefully Emacs, Firefox and Thunderbird will be safe.

I agree that it now looks 'nicer'. But if I actually want to use the app, the following interface is far superior:

    XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP=XFCE simple-scan

(For those looking for a work-around, the above command-line run from a terminal or script launches the app with the 'old' UI. You may also be able to use the menu editor to use your script).

Windows installer: Install MIME types for recently-used metadata files

note.body:
I have exactly the same request too.

WinMerge has such a function and it uses really simple XML like below for that purpose. The implementation should not be difficult for developers of meld.


```xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<project>
   <paths>
      <left>D:\xxxx\A\</left>
      <right>D:\xxxx\B\</right>
      <filter>*.*</filter>
      <subfolders>1</subfolders>
      <left-readonly>0</left-readonly>
      <right-readonly>0</right-readonly>
   </paths>
</project>



```

note.body:
Okay.

For those searching for a workaround, I found one: 

- You can configure networks via `nm-connection-editor`, without being troubled by a hanging GUI. 
- You could shortly start the old applet (`nm-applet`) to start connections from the menu bar. You can close the applet once you're done connecting to the network you want.
- You can activate/stop known connections from command line to if you like. E.g. `nmcli c up "my-connection"`

events.target_title: gdk_monitor_get_workarea: 'GDK_IS_MONITOR (monitor)' failed

note.body:
In gdk3, `gdk_display_get_primary_monitor` is [documented](https://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/GdkDisplay.html#gdk-display-get-primary-monitor) as potentially returning NULL, so you need to check for that.

The reason it returns NULL in this case is that the GDK Wayland backend doesn't implement it: #1028 

For the record, that function is apparently no longer nullable in gdk4: 76d95c312dde61334ee7cf3218a05c3ab485c922

events.target_title: [Regression] GtkProgressBar slows down and stops animating

note.body:
I think I understand why this is happening. In `gtkprogressbar.c:tick_cb`, there is a condition `if (current_iterations > 3 * pulse_iterations)` that stops the animation if there hasn't been a pulse call in a while, comparing the pulse `g_get_monotonic_time()` timestamps to the frame clock time. Over time, the frame clock time is drifting into the future, until the condition is satisfied automatically.

The frame clock drift seems to be caused by c6901a8b. In `gdkframeclockidle.c:gdk_frame_clock_paint_idle`, `smoothest_frame_time` (the previous frame time + `frame_interval`) is used as long as it is within [`compute_frame_time()` ± `frame_interval`]. This allows `frame_time` to be set slightly into the future.

The problem is if `compute_frame_time` finds that time has gone backward, it stores the difference (`timer_base`) and adds it to all future calls. The call in `frame_clock_paint_idle` doesn't affect `timer_base`, but the end of that function calls `maybe_start_idle`, which may call `compute_frame_time`  again (with `frame_time` now in the future). In my testing, it can also happen via calls to the `get_frame_time` method.

The `timer_base` logic in `compute_frame_time` seems like a leftover from when GTimer was used before `g_get_monotonic_time`. Removing it makes the problem go away for me, but I don't know if that is a proper solution. (P.S. there's also a leftover `GTimer *` in `GdkFrameClockIdlePrivate`.)

events.target_title: Crash when open txt file

note.body: The fact that three people using fedora 29 were able to duplicate, and I was able to duplicate using the file from one of the other reporters, but the gedit maintainers are not able to duplicate make me suspect something else in the fedora stack may be an issue here.  As such, I opened https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1658033 and linked it to this bug.

events.target_title: "Email Signed" and/or "Email Encrypted" field in mails list view icon missing
